image.altText: A Palestinian man kisses another man's cheek after being reunited.

props.synopsis: Nearly 2,000 Palestinians who were imprisoned in Israel have been reunited with their families as part of an exchange for hostages held by Hamas in Gaza.

title.children: 'Rotten food' and 'torture': Palestinian prisoners allege abuse in detention

image.altText: James Paterson looks serious past the camera.

props.synopsis: In a major address to his party, James Paterson says "marginal" voices agitating for the Liberal party to split must be kept on the sidelines, cautioning it would spell "disaster".

title.children: Senior conservative cautions Liberals quietly pushing to split the party

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses, a light-coloured blouse and dark blazer smiles while posing for a photo in front of a leafy backdrop.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Crisafulli government is embroiled in a new "jobs for mates" claim after it appointed a Liberal National Party powerbroker to oversee the state's lead agency for disaster recovery.

title.children: New 'jobs for mates' claim over LNP government appointment

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference.

props.synopsis: After two years of refusing to reshape his superannuation shake-up, the treasurer abandons the idea of taxing unrealised gains while agreeing to index a key tax threshold.

title.children: An embarrassing backflip by Chalmers on super or a strategic shift?

image.altText: A red petrol station sign shows prices for ULP at 229.9 cents per litre, sunset in the distance

props.synopsis: Industry experts say there is no excuse for wild variations in fuel prices across Australia, as calls grow for an independent investigation into the disparity.

title.children: 'Doesn't pass the pub test': Why is fuel so expensive in some parts of Australia?

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone surrounded by icons from social media platforms

props.synopsis: An emotional plea to the country, concerns about privacy and how Australia's social media ban will actually work. These are the key takeaways from the ABC's Your Say: The Digital Dilemma forum.

title.children: Five takeaways from the ABC's Your Say: The Digital Dilemma forum

image.altText: People wave the Madagascar flag from a pickup truck driving through a crowd.

props.synopsis: The country's parliament voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina after he fled the country in the face of growing opposition from soldiers and police.

title.children: Military announces takeover of Madagascar after president flees

image.altText: An unidentifiable person's hands holding an unlit cigarette and a lit red lighter.

props.synopsis: Internal tobacco industry data estimates the illicit tobacco market now makes up 64 per cent of all tobacco consumed in Australia and 82 per cent of the total nicotine consumed.

title.children: Australia's illicit tobacco problem could get worse due to perfect storm

image.altText: A man slings his arm around a woman's shoulders and kisses her on the cheek

props.synopsis: Noa and Avinatan's abduction from a music festival became an enduring illustration of the horrors endured by Israelis on October 7. Now safely in each other's arms, a chapter has closed on a harrowing two years.

title.children: Abducted by Hamas, Noa never lost hope she would see her 'soulmate' again

image.altText: Smoke rising from a building on a busy street.

props.synopsis: At least 16 people have died after a fire broke out in a garment factory and a nearby chemical warehouse in Bangladesh.

title.children: Bangladesh garment factory fire kills 16, toll may rise, official says

image.altText: Large ship seen from above.

props.synopsis: Antarctic icebreaker RSV Nuyina has headed to deeper waters off remote Heard Island in the Southern Ocean while assessments are undertaken to see if the hull has suffered any damage after scraping the ocean floor.

title.children: Damage assessment underway after Australian icebreaker scrapes ocean floor

image.altText: Anthony Albanese uses his phone on the floor of the House of Represenatives, wears orange tie, green seat.

props.synopsis: Sussan Ley and other prominent Australians are among those whose details have also been made available on a US-based website.

title.children: Anthony Albanese's mobile phone number released online

image.altText: Smiling dark-haired Brittany in a dark blazer walks down a street, 7 news mic thrust in front, Sharaz walks beside.

props.synopsis: Former senator Linda Reynolds files a creditor's petition in the Federal Court against her ex-staffer, Brittany Higgins, as she tries to recover damages awarded to her for defamation.

title.children: Higgins faces bankruptcy proceedings as Reynolds takes new legal action

image.altText: A sun burning bright in an orange sky above clouds on the horizon.

props.synopsis: Parts of Pilbara and Kimberley surpassed 40 degrees Celsius yesterday but meteorologists say the temperatures will not trigger a heatwave warning yet.

title.children: Hottest place on Earth located in Australia as 'heat engine' cranks into gear

image.altText: Dave Hughes in a video posted to social media platform, Instagram, lying in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Comedian Dave Hughes has returned to hospital, six weeks after suffering five broken ribs and a punctured lung in the AFL's Legends game.

title.children: Dave Hughes in hospital again six weeks after AFL Legends game

image.altText: Composite photo of Gordon Twaddle, Karen Edwards, and Tim Thomson.

props.synopsis: Bruce Preston was once accused of killing three tourists in Mount Isa in 1978, but the prosecution was later dropped.

title.children: Man once accused of tourist triple murder gives evidence at cold case inquest

image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: The chief executive and chief operating officer at one of Australia's biggest childcare chains have resigned following a string of scandals, including dozens of sex abuse charges being laid against a former employee.

title.children: Top executives at Affinity Education Group resign after childcare scandals

props.synopsis: Visitors to a northern New South Wales wildlife sanctuary were forced to evacuate after a woman brought in a rescued sea snake, one of the world's deadliest reptiles.

title.children: 'Highly venomous' sea snake forces wildlife centre evacuation

image.altText: A man with mouth wide open, distressed, blood on face, arm in air, no shirt on, in bush

props.synopsis: Horror films can be a great training ground for filmmakers, but there is also a gritty reality, a panel of indie producers tells SXSW Sydney.

title.children: Indie producers spill their guts on making horror films for a living

image.altText: Aerial view of several homes and a large building under flood waters

props.synopsis: A Eugowra resident tells an inquest into deadly flooding how she put her six-day-old granddaughter in a roof cavity after a wave of water hit the Central West town, killing two people.

title.children: How a 'day of hell' unfolded during fatal 'inland tsunami'

image.altText: Kane Minion wearing a beanie with a dog sleeping on his chest

props.synopsis: After meter reader Kane Minion was fatally mauled by dogs at a Queensland property, the Coroners Court hears details about the electricity provider's work procedures.

title.children: Meter reader contractor not paid when workers skipped houses due to dogs, inquest hears

image.altText: Socceroos player Nestory Irankunda

props.synopsis: The Socceroos' friendly against the United States is a positive step in their World Cup preparation, while a positive result could also influence their tournament draw.

title.children: Socceroos' friendly against US could impact World Cup draw

image.altText: Woman with respiratory illness, blowing her nose into handkerchief.

props.synopsis: Western Australia records its worst flu season on record, with more than 30,000 influenza cases reported this year.

title.children: WA records worst-ever flu season amid poor vaccination rates

image.altText: SES volunteers and ADF personnel and a bus in sparse bushland

props.synopsis: As SA Police and the Australian Defence Force resume their search for missing four-year-old Gus in South Australia's arid mid-north, authorities have announced a new taskforce.

title.children: 'No evidence' during new Gus search, as police announce taskforce

image.altText: wrecked boat on beach

props.synopsis: Authorities say they were concerned about the seaworthiness of a vessel that left port in Ballina early on Monday and broke apart less than 24 hours later off Kingscliff in northern NSW.

title.children: 'Covered in seaweed', shipwrecked skipper swims to pub to call for help

image.altText: A man with hiking gear and sunglasses crouches in front of a cliff overlooking a river.

props.synopsis: A search is underway for a Tasmanian man in Mount Field National Park in challenging, snowy conditions after his last contact on Sunday morning said he would seek shelter.

title.children: Search continues in 'waist-high' snow for photographer hiking in Tasmanian bush

image.altText: A man in a black suit leaves court talking on his mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Alexander Thomas Hallett pleaded guilty to winding back a total of 648,000 kilometres on the odometers of seven vehicles.

title.children: Used car salesman fined $25,000 for winding back car odometers

image.altText: Nick Dametto speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party MP Nick Dametto has formally resigned from state parliament to run for Townsville mayor — forcing a by-election in his north Queensland seat.

title.children: Katter MP thanks himself 'for turning up' as he resigns from state parliament

image.altText: A faded colour image of a brown roofed building surrounded by a verandah with a garden at the front.

props.synopsis: A former detainee at a notorious Central Coast juvenile justice facility is suing the state of NSW over alleged sexual abuse.

title.children: Court hears of 'appalling history' of abuse at juvenile justice centre

image.altText: An older man in a suit stands behind a lecturn with another man standing beside him, in front of Noosa council sign.

props.synopsis: The mayor of a small council that lost nearly $2 million in a "sophisticated" scam says international fraudsters were able to "imitate personalities" using AI.

title.children: AI used to imitate personalities defrauds Noosa council of $2.3m

image.altText: Signage for Santos is displayed outside the company's visitor information center in Narrabri

props.synopsis: It was a primary force behind Australia’s inflationary surge, it’s forced businesses either to the wall or to shift offshore, undermined national industry policy and resulted in the loss of countless thousands of jobs. And it all hinged on one disastrous decision in an Adelaide boardroom.

title.children: How a boardroom mistake in Adelaide 15 years ago cost you a fortune

image.altText: Zach Merrett looks to his left after the Bombers lost to the Swans.

props.synopsis: The big three of Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca remain in limbo with one day left in the trade period, with Brayden Fiorini going from Gold Coast to Essendon the main move of the day.

title.children: Bombers position ‘unchanged’ on Merrett after Hawks' offer, as Swans chase Curnow

image.altText: People walk through an covered in mud and debris from a flood

props.synopsis: The death toll from flooding in Mexico's central region has risen to 64, with another 65 people missing, according to the Mexican government.

title.children: Almost 130 people dead or missing in  Mexico floods
